heading: Welcome
text: Welcome Cockburn Sound Integrated Ecosystem Model  (\(\mathbf{CSIEM}\)) information pages!

heading: Project background
text: Cockburn Sound marine embayment Western Australia supports wide range environmental, cultural, social economic values. development Cockburn Sound Integrated Ecosystem Model seeks deliver state---art environmental modelling tool able support understanding iconic environment. report documents CSIEM technical specification, including model integrates historical data new findings science projects undertaken within WAMSI Westport Research program. developed, improvements model functional capability, detailed validation tests, assessment various management climate scenarios reported .

heading: 4.1 CSIEM repository structure and organisation
text: CSIEM repository ecosystem designed way facilitate sharing data models across various agencies researchers, well providing formalised structure store, catalogue process complex unique datasets. Comparmentalised data structures implemented allow tracking version control data models utilised upgraded throughout project. Given complexitites scope requirements, four interconnected repositories created house share accumulated project outputs:csiem-science: repository documenting CSIEM workflows, model-data structure integration, results (current CSIEM bookdown online manual);csiem-data: platform storing sharing environmental data project (see Chapter 3);csiem-model: platform storing sharing model files configurations;csiem-marvl: collection scripts visualising, assessing reporting data model performance.Github chosen house repository based ’s mature version control systems cross platform program support aid stakeholders accessing data models (https://github.com/). addition, wide variety documentation online assist users new GitHub. Information clone publicly available GitHub repository can found .Data cataloguing via “CSIEM Data Catalogue” (described Section 3.3) designed cross-agency usage mind. Integration WAMSI Theme 10 Data Catalogue essential allow tracking data changes upgrades throughout project, used modelling purposes. “Point Truth”, “WAMSI Catalogue Classification” “Status Notes” categories included CSIEM Data Catalogue track dataset’s evolution throughout project.

heading: 4.3.1 Simulation naming and organization
text: model files stored csiem-model repository. model developed time, model files classified project names model generation identifiers. naming model folders follows convention {Agency Code}_{Program Code}_{Model Code}_{Model Version}_{Model Period}, ‘Agency Code’ includes organizations :WaterCorp: model files used assessing PSDP Water Corporation;Westport: model files developed assessing Westport Phase 1 scenarios; andWAMSI: core CSIEM model files updated throughout WAMSI Westport integration project.identifier fields optional included whereas available. ‘Program Code’ indicates research program model deveoped ; ‘Model Code’ indicate model used, ‘Model Version’ indicates version model development, ‘Model Period’ indicates time simulations. example, model folder WAMSI_wwmsp_tfvaed_gen0_2021_2022 includes preliminary version model files developed WAMSI WWMSP program using TUFLOW-fv-AED model, focusing time 2021-2022.Following models existing development uploaded onto csiem-model repository:WAMSI_wwmsp_tfvaed_gen0_2021_2022: preliminary version model files developed WAMSI WWMSP program using TUFLOW-fv-AED model, focusing time 2021-2022;WAMSI_wwmsp_tfvaed_gen1_2021_2022: BMT Cycle 1 model files WAMSI WWMSP program;WAMSI_wwmsp_wwm_gen1_2011_2021: WAMSI theme 5.2 wave simulation Cockburn Sound;WaterCorp_psdp2_tfvaed: previous BMT model files assessing Perth Seawater Desalination Plant 2 multiple periods;WestPort_breakwater_swan_2011_2020: BMT SWAN wave simulation west port;WestPort_dmp_tfvst_2011_2020: BMT TUFLOW sediment transport simulation west port;model folder may contain multiple simulation sets, rely model base configuration, minor differences adujstments. Major changes model’s configuration constitute change generation numeber stored separate folder. Note, models uploaded CSIEM repository may created different agencies researchers maintain consistent naming convention.

heading: 4.3.2 CSIEM TUFLOW-FV-AED model file organisation
text: TUFLOW-FV-AED model main modelling platform WWMSP project contains following folder structure:BCs: boundary condition files, including tide inflow boundary files; meteorological boundary files, initial condition files;External: AED model files linked TUFLOW-FV, optionally ‘GOTM’ vertical mixing model CSIEM 3D mode;Geo: TUFLOW-FV model structure files, including geometry mesh files, GIS files controlling nodestrings material zones;Input: model control/configuration files;Plotting : Directory store model output images;WINDOWS users model folder also contains bin directory containing windows binaries TFV-AED modelTFV: Build version: 2020.03.105AED: Build version: 2.0.5b

heading: 4.4 Model Assessment, Reporting and Visualisation Toolbox Repository
text:
publicly available GitHub repository called csiem-marvl contains wide variety matlab scripts functions used process visualise model output. Scripts specifically developed project contained within csiem-marvl repository. Plotting model processing types include:Time-series plotting;Transect plotting;Model animation creation;Error assessment;Wave model plotting;Habitat mapping (e.g., Ruppia & Fish HSI processing mapping)Scenario comparison “DelMap” plotting;Nutrient budget assessments.particular, AEDmarvl_plot_timeseries AEDmarvl_plot_transect main functions frequently used. AEDmarvl_plot_timeseries function uses data gis files stored csiem-marvl repository, addition model output create timeseries plots model (averaged within polygon region) compared field data. plotting function also automatically calculate range error statistics based model output field measured data.
Figure 4.5: Example output plottfv_polygon error matrix
AEDmarvl_plot_transect can also found csiem-marvl repository. plots model data extracted along transect line specified plotting period, compares range field data found within period.
Figure 4.6: Example output plottfv_transect distance Goolwa Barrage (km) along x-axis
csiem-marvl analysis library also houses scripts functions :Nutrient Budgeting;Stacked Area Transect;Curtain plotting;Mesh manipulation tools;Data exports;Sheet plotting animation tools;example plots previous research projects using marvl-similar scripts shown illustrating capability presentations. csiem-marvl analysis library currently development meet needs data collection modelling progress, sediment profiling habitat index.

Shared Environmental Analytics Facility cloud-based, multi-zonal analytics prototype developed support Cockburn Sound environmental impact assessment process WAMSI, partnership Microsoft, PwC Australia, Sentient Hubs Pawsey Supercomputer Research Centre. core prototype development open, standardised platform support modelling data services diverse agencies companies, secure robust platform. Built Microsoft’s Azure platform, utilising modelling expertise Sentient Hub’s, SEAF prototype designed facilitate complex modelling projects whilst maintainig high degree data security, transparancy repeatability.Based around Microsoft’s Analytics Landing Zone, can described Analytics Platform Box, single zone allows agency carry highly complex workflows, whilst maintaining high degree security tranparency. Metadata logging phase project allows reproducability results, standardisation inherent ALZ means results can repoduced outside single agencies ALZ. heading: 5.1 Overview
text:
previous chapters detailed nature model setup, additions areas development. section, model assessed entirety, using fully coupled model, complete dataset. approach assess model loosely follows CSPS framework Hipsey et al. (2020). framework considers:Level 0: conceptual evaluation; conceptual diagrams water quality variables, biogeochemical reactions, habitat modelling based scientific review data inspection detailed previous chapters;Level 1: simulated state variables; range metrics used large number predicted variable different sites.Level 2: process rates; andLevel 3: system-level patterns emergent properties; evaluated overall nutrient budget analysis, nutrient cycling pathway analysis, assessment relationship areas habitat seagrass.specific data available validation assessment metrics used described next. level model uncertainty discussed terms much confidence current generation model outputs purposes defining model reliability.addition model performance assessment, model also routinely used support management decision-making. Detail provided diverse model outputs can processed analysed informing decision making applications.
## Model assessment approach

heading: 5.1.1 Summary of validation data-set
text: field observation data available model validation assessment include diversity historical data (collected pre 2021), large volume data generated recent monitoring WAMSI-Westport research projects. Relevant data validation include:situ water quality sensors; high frequency measurements fixed locations.Water quality grab samplesBiotic surveysStrategic experimental data.data relevant model calibration validation included CSIEM Data Catalogue detailed Appendix . data spans wide range locations time-periods; however primary model assessment focus intense period monitoring. Long-term assessments also undertaken different versions model, outlined next.

heading: 5.1.2 Performance assessment metrics
text: modelling results compared historical data collected within Cockburn Sound (available), using traditional statistical metrics model error, metrics relevant model performance. approach applied model generation aim identify areas model accurate, areas improvement ongoing calibration effort.Error metrics : Initially, model performance predicting range relevant variables including salinity, temperature, nitrogen, phosphorus total chlorophyll-assessed set statistical metrics, calculations statistical metrics performed observation site number field observations >10 assessment period.core statistical metrics considered consist :\(r\): regression coefficient, Varies -1 1, score 1 indicating model varies perfectly observations negative score indicating model varies inversely observations. consistent bias may present even high score r obtained.\(BIAS\): bias average prediction average observation assessing period. method presents magnitude discrepancy model results observational data.\(MAE\): mean absolute error: Similar RMSE except absolute value used. reduces bias towards large events. Values near zero indicate good model skill.\(RMS\): root mean squared error, Measures mean magnitude, direction, difference model data observations, hence can used measure bias. Values near zero desirable. method affected cancellation negative positive errors, squaring data may cause bias towards large events.\(nash\): Nash-Sutcliffe metric (also called \(NSE\) \(MEF\) matrix modelling efficiency, measures mean magnitude difference model data observations. method compares performance model uses mean observed data. value 1 indicate perfect model, value zero indicates performance similar simply using mean observed data.Seasonality : model results assessed terms degree seasonal fluctuation, seen field data. Whilst captured error metrics (e.g. R, visual assessment can assess timing issues related seasonal peaks.Transects : model results assessed terms seasonal mean along length domain (longitudinal transect). transect analysis allows system wide scale assessment conditions, smooths noise local variability field model predictions.Advanced measures : model results finally assessed considered partitioning nutrients terms inorganic vs organic, expected measures.Confidence : Based assessment evaluate confidence model assigning variable following categories:GoodAcceptable, andCaution.confidence evaluation, considers:Quality observed data, influenced field laboratory data limitations, methodologies, processes protocols.Error metric scores relative typically reported literature water quality models (e.g., Arhonditsis Brett, 2004).Ability CSIEM capture mean indicator spatial gradient seasonality.Partitioning water quality constituents within different ecosystem pools.Natural variability indicator different temporal scales (.e. sub-daily seasonal).

heading: 5.2 Assessment and validation periods
text: Historical period: 1970-2010: initial assessment prior availability WAMSI research project data;Recent period: 2010-2020: initial assessment prior availability WAMSI research project data;Focus period: 2021-2022: initial calibrated intensive field sampling observations obtained different components WAMSI research project;Long-term performance: 2017 – 2022: calibrated long-term water quality data collected routine measurements, well WAMSI research project. results summarised .
